physical_appearance: This is a black-and-white photograph. It is rectangular in shape and landscape in orientation. It features a road, stretching from one side of the photograph to the other. On the right of the photograph, there is a race car with a driver seated in it. On the left of the car by the road, there are several people seated on the grass patch. There are no inscriptions on the photograph. There are no tears or folds seen.
sgcool_label_text: This is a personal photograph album that belonged to a Corporal A. Silver who spent 16 months in Singapore between 1951 and 1952. Silver was presumably a Jewish lady who was stationed in Singapore to serve at the Royal Air Force (RAF) Hospital at Changi. The album contains photographs that document her working and personal life, including friends she made within the Jewish community in Singapore.
title_text: "Personal photograph album titled ""Sixteen Months in Singapore""" Sixteen Months in Singapore: Photograph of race car on a road with spectators
subject_terms_1: races (events) automobile racing spectators (event observers) snapshots
